DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Collection Quantity Volume Or Weight Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric value related to the volume or weight of the umbilical cord blood collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number. [Manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering something together.:Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.
